    Internship Management System

    System Overview

    The Internship Management System is a comprehensive Java application designed to streamline the internship placement process for educational institutions. The system facilitates interaction between students, company representatives, and career center staff.

    Key Features

    • Student Portal: Browse internships, submit applications, and manage placements
    • Company Portal: Post internship opportunities and manage applications
    • Staff Portal: Oversee system operations, approve company registrations, internship listings and generate reports
    • Role-based Access: Secure authentication and authorization

    Package Structure

    Core Packages

    • boundary - User interface layer and console interactions
    • controller - Business logic and application flow
    • entity - Domain models and data entities
    • database - Data persistence and repository layer

    Getting Started

    To begin exploring the system documentation:

    1. Use the Module view for a comprehensive overview of the entire system architecture, package descriptions, and key components
    2. Use the Tree view to see the complete package hierarchy
    3. Check the Index for alphabetical listing of all classes and members
    4. Use the Search function to find specific classes or methods
    5. Visit the Help page for documentation usage tips
